Section Header:
REDCap Program Information

For the purposes of this survey:

Your "REDCap Program" is defined as the combination of project user support offerings, choice of application upgrade cycles (standard vs LTS) and control center configurations. It includes the experience and guidance your staff provides to your users and your insitution about REDCap.
Field Label:
How would you classify your REDCap program?

In general, how do you feel about your program's project user support offerings, the ease of application upgrade cycles, and the experience / guidance  your program provides to your users and your insitution about REDCap. 

How do you think your program compares to other REDCap programs?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, We're in a startup phase. | 2, We're past start up, and would classify our program as beginner. | 3, We're somewhere in the middle / intermediate. | 4, Our program has been around awhile, and we're still working on improvements. | 5, Our program is a well-oiled machine.

Field Label:
How would you classify the current growth phase of your program?

Growth can be defined as an increased interest in your REDCap program, increase of new and/or active users, and/or increase of new and/or active projects.
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Implementation Phase - Haven't started onboarding users or projects yet. | 2, We're just starting to onboard users/projects. | 3, We're in a steady growth phase. | 4, We're in a rapid growth phase. | 5, Our growth has plateaued (leveled off, slowed/no growth).

Field Label: In general, what's your REDCap Project Support model?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, We offer no / minimal REDCap project user support | 1, We offer REDCap project support at no charge for all project users | 2, We offer REDCap project support and charge all project users | 3, We offer REDCap project support with both: no charge and charge model(s)

Field Label: How is your REDCap program funded?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Institutional Operating Funds | 2, NIH CTSA Grant | 3, Project Grants or Contracts | 4, Cost Recovery Model (Charge backs) | 98, Other {program_funding_other}

Field Label: Other
What Department / Team primarily supports your REDCap program?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Information Systems/Technology Infrastructure | 2, Information Systems/Technology Applications | 3, Academic / Research Programs | 4, Data Management / Quality | 5, Biostats / Analytics | 7, Clinical Trials Office | 6, REDCap Team (more than 4 people dedicated only to REDCap) | 98, Other {support_type_other}

Field Label:
How many people (including yourself) support your REDCap Program in any capacity (technical or end user support)? Please count each person regardless of whether they are partially funded or part-time in their role as REDCap support.

For example:
If you have 1 full time person and 1 half-time person who supports your REDCap program you would enter 2 people.
Field Annotation: Specifically not FTE. Want the raw number of administrators that support REDCap regardless of partially funded support. Changed validation to interger @PLACEHOLDER='Number of people'

Field Label:
What is the total Full Time Effort (FTE) that generally supports your REDCap program in any capacity (technical or end user support)? Please total the effort and represent the number as a decimal. 

For example:
If you have 1 full time person and 1 half-time person who supports your REDCap program you would have 1.5 FTE.

For each of the categories below, enter how many people and how many FTEs spend their time working on those categories.

Role People Full Time Equivalents (FTE)
Server or technical support {admin_server} {admin_server_fte}
End user (project user) support {admin_user} {admin_user_fte}
Coding {admin_code} {admin_coding_fte}
How many people provide server or technical support?
How much FTE is spent on server or technical support ? (average over the year)
How many people provide end user (project user) support?
How much FTE is spent on end user support?
How many people spend time on coding?
How much FTE is spent on coding?

If you were hiring today, at what salary range would you hire...

Position Salary
...an entry level REDCap administrator? {sal_entry}
...mid-level REDCap administrator? {sal_mid}
...a senior REDCap administrator? {sal_sen}

Please note currency in your response.
What salary range would you hire an entry level REDCap administrator?
What salary range would you hire an mid level REDCap administrator?
What salary range would you hire a senior REDCap administrator?
Is there other noteworthy compensation forms offered at your institution?
25%

Section Header:
REDCap Instance Information

If your program supports multiple REDCap production instances, you should designate one as your "Primary REDCap Instance" and answer the questions consistently in reference to that instance. 

Many institutions only have one instance for their user population. If you support multiple instances, think of your "primary instance" as the one used by the most users at your institution/organization and used by the most diverse group of users. If you're so inclined and you have more than one "primary instance", you can complete more than one survey!
Field Label:
How many REDCap instances does your team support?

For example:

  • Separate Regulatory/Security instance
  • Separate instance(s) for different campuses
  • Perhaps you have separate instances for special purposes

Do not include dev-only servers that do not host real data

When was your Primary REDCap Instance initialized?

{redcap_start_date}

If you have access to the Database Query Tool (control center), you can run this query to determine when the first project was created:

SELECT 
    project_id, creation_time
FROM
    redcap_projects
WHERE
    project_id IN (SELECT 
            MIN(project_id)
        FROM
            redcap_projects)
  • If unknown, best guess is okay.
  • If you administer / support more than one instance, pick the earliest instance.
Who does your Primary REDCap Instance serve / support?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Limited to specific types of users, groups, departments or projects | 2, One Institution / Organization | 3, Multiple Institutions / Organizations | 98, Other {redcap_pop_other}

Field Label: When was your Primary REDCap Instance initialized?

How many active end users does your Primary REDCap Instance support?

{active_users}

To find the number of end users, please run this query:

SELECT 
    COUNT(*) AS ActiveUsers
FROM
    redcap_user_information
WHERE
    DATEDIFF(NOW(), user_lastactivity) < 183
How many active end users does your Primary REDCap Instance support?

How many active projects does your Primary REDCap Instance support?

To find the number of projects, please run this query:

SELECT 
    COUNT(*) AS ActiveProjects
FROM
    redcap_projects
WHERE
    DATEDIFF(NOW(), last_logged_event) < 183

How many logged events does your Primary REDCap Instance have in the past 30 days?

{logged_events}

You can find this graph by navigating to your Control Center and selecting "System Statistics" from the left hand menu.
How many logged events does your Primary REDCap Instance have in the past 30 days?
How many external modules (internal or external), hooks, or plugins does your REDCap Program support? Please add all modules across all instances.

Please navigate to your Primary REDCap Instance Control Center -> User Settings and record your settings below.
Do you...
Allow normal users to create new projects? {ccus_createprojects}
Allow normal users to move projects to production? {ccus_moveprod}
Allow production Draft Mode changes to be approved automatically under certain conditions? {ccus_changerequests}
Allow normal users to modify the 'Repeating Instruments & Events' settings for projects while in production status? {ccus_repeatingsetup}
Allow normal users to add or modify events and arms on the Define My Events page for longitudinal projects while in production status? {ccus_addevents}
What is you user authentication method? {ccus_authenticate}
Allow normal users to create new projects?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Yes, normal users can create new projects | 0, No, only Administrators can create projects

Field Label: Allow normal users to move projects to production?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Yes, normal users can move projects to production | 0, No, only Administrators can move projects to production

Field Label: Allow production Draft Mode changes to be approved automatically under certain conditions?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, Never (always require an admin to approve changes) | 1, Yes, if no existing fields were modified | 2, Yes, if project has no records OR it has records and no existing fields were modified | 3, Yes, if no critical issues exist | 4, Yes, if project has no records OR it has records and no critical issues exist

Field Label: Allow normal users to modify the 'Repeating Instruments & Events' settings for projects while in production status?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, No, only Administrators can modify the repeating instance setup in production | 1, Yes, normal users can modify the repeating instance setup in production

Field Label: Allow normal users to add or modify events and arms on the Define My Events page for longitudinal projects while in production status?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, No, only Administrators can add/modify events in production | 1, Yes, normal users can add/modify events in production

Field Label: What is you user authentication method?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Table-based | 2, LDAP (or any institutional sign-on like Shibboleth, OpenID, etc.) | 3, Both Table-based + LDAP | 99, I don't know

Field Label: 50%

Section Header:
Support Model Questions

The next questions ask about various functionalities in REDCap. We would like to know if your REDCap Admin team provides support for any of these if a project requires that functionality.

Term Description
Always This is a key functionality we support
Sometimes Our support is on a case-by-case basis
Never We never support this or this functionality is not allowed or available on our instance
I don't know Please choose this if you have never heard of the functionality or have no current plan on whether or not your team would support it.

How would you categorize your charge model(s)?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Bill by time/effort (ex: hourly) | 2, Staff % Effort (designated percent allocation to grant/contract/department) | 3, Published services with rates | 4, Subscription | 98, Other {charge_type_other}

Field Label: Why do you have a charge model?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Cost Recovery | 2, Demand Management | 3, To offer additional support / supplement "no cost" support for project users | 4, To provide advanced services, like API integration or External Module / custom project features | 5, To fund additional FTE support for the program | 6, To support specific projects/grants/contracts/departments | 98, Other {charge_reasons_other}

Field Label:
How many staff support your charge model for REDCap services? 

Please count each person regardless of whether they are partially funded or part-time in their REDCap role. Include any staff that perform REDCap work and/or are on your REDCap team and are involved in the charge model. 

Do not include individuals that are only involved in billing / administration (ex: project manager, time keeper). Includes those individials in question below.

For example: If you have 1 full time person and 1 half-time person who supports your charge model you would enter 2 people.
Is your charge model effort:
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Overstaffed | 2, Appropriately staffed | 3, Understaffed

Field Label: Do you think your charge model is successful?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Not at all | 2, Somewhat | 3, Very

Field Label: What's one thing that makes your charge model(s) successful?
What's your biggest challenge with your charge model(s)?

How/who is billing handled at your institution?

Please include information about individuals required for administrative effort of the charge model (ex: project manager, time keeper).
How satisfied are you with how fees are handled?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Completely satisfied | 2, Somewhat satisfied | 3, Neutral | 4, Somewhat dissatisifed | 5, Very dissatisfied

Field Label: What levels of regulatory and/or security compliance do you provide for your system(s)?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, None / Not Applicable | 1, HIPAA - Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act Privacy Rule | 2, FDA 21 Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) Part 11 Compliant | 3, Good Clinical Practice (GCP) International Council for Harmonisation (ICH) E6(R2) | 4, Federal Information Security Modernization Act (FISMA) High | 5, FISMA Medium | 6, FISMA Low | 7, GDPR - General Data Protection Regulation - European Union | 98, Other {sec_type_oth}

Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Always | 2, Sometimes | 3, Never | 99, I don't know

Field Label: What is your charge model for your regulatory and/or security compliant system?

Do you provide full or partial *Systems Validation for any of your REDCap Instances?

*in regards to regulatory compliance with Good Clinical Practice (GCP) International Council for Harmonisation (ICH) E6(R2) and The United States Food and Drug Administration (FDA) Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) Title 21 Part 11. 

For this survey, please answer "yes" if you perform systems validation for any reason, including module/workflow specific like eConsent validation.
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Yes | 0, No | 2, Not currently, but plan to support

Field Label: Who performed your initial Systems Validation?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Hired contractors / consultants (outsource) | 2, REDCap Program staff | 3, Other institutional staff (non-REDCap staff) | 98, Other {who_val_other}

Field Label:
Are you willing to share the total costs associated with consultants for the initial validation? If yes, please provide value:

If you cannot share exact value, can you share range of costs other institutions should prepare for? 

  • Range could be based on Consultant Quote vs Actual Spend.
  • And/or if you received multiple quotes from different consultants, your range could be based on the different quotes.

Who performs your ongoing Systems Validation?

If you've only completed initial systems validation, indicate who will perform future and ongoing validation.
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Hired contractors (outsource) | 2, REDCap Program staff | 3, Other institutional staff (non-REDCap staff) | 98, Other {who_val_other_ongoing}

Range may include minor application upgrades effort/cost to major upgrades effort/cost.

Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Yes | 0, No | 99, I don't know

Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Yes | 0, No | 99, I don't know

Field Label:
How many staff support your Systems Validation? 

Please count each person regardless of whether they are partially funded or part-time in their REDCap role. Count individuals that contribute substantially to the effort, such as Authors, Validation Leads and Test Team. Do not count individuals who only review and sign documentation.

For example: If you have 1 full time person and 1 half-time person who supports Systems Validation you would enter 2 people.
Is your Systems Validation effort:
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Overstaffed | 2, Appropriately staffed | 3, Understaffed

Field Label:
Who provides Audit support to your REDCap project users?

For example, who would work directly with the FDA agent if they had questions about a clinical research study using REDCap?  Who supports a FISMA Audit?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, REDCap Admins | 2, Research Compliance | 3, Clinical Trials Office | 4, Security and Privacy Office | 5, Information Security | 6, Unsure | 7, Unsure who supports but confident it's outside our area of responsibility | 98, Other {audit_support_other}
